what: Interval Wise Testing for Functional Data
title: Interval Wise Testing for Functional Data
text: goal fdatest implement various statistical methods domain selection functional data analysis, selecting subset domain difference two populations significant. package based paper Abramowicz et al. (2022) Pini & Vantini (2017).

title: Interval Wise Testing for Functional Data
text: can install package CRAN : Alternatively, can install development version fdatest GitHub :
code: install.packages("fdatest") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("permaverse/fdatest")

title: Interval Wise Testing for Functional Data
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(fdatest)  # Performing the TWT for two populations on the NASA temperatures data set withr::with_seed(1234, {   out <- TWT2(NASAtemp$paris, NASAtemp$milan) }) #> [1] "Threshold-wise tests"  # Plotting the results of the TWT plot(   out,    xrange = c(0, 12),    main = 'TWT results for testing mean differences' )

what: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2
title: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2
text: function implements functional Benjamini Hochberg (fBH) procedure testing mean differences two functional populations. Functional data tested locally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls family-wise error rate asymptotically.

title: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2
code: FDR2(   data1,   data2,   mu = 0,   B = 1000L,   paired = FALSE,   dx = NULL,   alternative = "two.sided" )

title: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2
text: data1 First population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n1 units rows. data2 Second population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n2 units rows. mu Functional mean difference null hypothesis. Three possibilities available mu: constant (case, constant function used); J-dimensional vector containing evaluations grid data evaluated; fd object package fda containing one function. default mu=0. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. defualt B=1000. paired logical indicating whether paired test performed. Default FALSE. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step grid  used evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100 used. Default NULL. alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis, must one "two.sided" (default), "greater" "less".

title: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2
text: object class fdatest2 containing following components: test: String vector indicating type test performed. case equal "2pop". mu: Evaluation grid functional mean difference null hypothesis (entered user). unadjusted_pval: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function. adjusted_pval: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function. data.eval: Evaluation grid functional data. ord_labels: Vector labels indicating group membership data.eval.

title: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2
text: Lundtorp Olsen, N., Pini, ., & Vantini, S. (2021). False discovery rate functional data TEST 30, 784–809.

title: Two population functional Benjamini-Hochberg procedure — FDR2

what: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2
title: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2
text: function implements Global Testing procedure testing mean differences two functional populations. Functional data tested locally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls interval-wise error rate.

title: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2
code: Global2(   data1,   data2,   mu = 0,   B = 1000L,   paired = FALSE,   dx = NULL,   stat = "Integral" )

title: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2
text: data1 First population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n1 units rows. data2 Second population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n2 units rows. mu Functional mean difference null hypothesis. Three possibilities available mu: constant (case, constant function used); J-dimensional vector containing evaluations grid data evaluated; fd object package fda containing one function. default mu=0. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. defualt B=1000. paired logical indicating whether paired test performed. Default FALSE. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step grid  used evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100 used. Default NULL. stat Test statistic used global test. Possible values : "Integral": integral squared sample mean difference; "Max": maximum squared sample mean difference; "Integral_std": integral squared t-test statistic; "Max_std": maximum squared t-test statistic. Default "Integral".

title: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2
text: object class fdatest2, containing following components: test: String vector indicating type test performed. case equal "2pop". mu: Evaluation grid functional mean difference null hypothesis (entered user). unadjusted_pval: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function (constant function according global testing procedure). adjusted_pval: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function. data.eval: Evaluation grid functional data. ord_labels: Vector labels indicating group membership data.eval.

title: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2
text: . Pini S. Vantini (2017). Interval Testing Procedure: Inference Functional Data Controlling Family Wise Error Rate Intervals. Biometrics 73(3): 835–845. Pini, ., & Vantini, S. (2017). Interval-wise testing functional data. Journal Nonparametric Statistics, 29(2), 407-424

title: Two population Global Testing procedure — Global2

what: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
title: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
text: function implements Global Testing procedure testing mean differences several functional populations one-way multi-way functional analysis variance framework. Functional data tested globally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls family-wise error rate weakly. Since global test, adjusted p-value function constant.

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
code: Globalaov(   formula,   B = 1000,   dx = NULL,   recycle = TRUE,   method = "residuals",   stat = "Integral" )

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. output variable formula can either matrix dimension c(n,J) collecting pointwise evaluations n functional data grid J points, fd object package fda. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. Defaults 1000L. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step gridused evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100L used. Defaults NULL. recycle Flag used decide whether recycled version IWT used (see Pini Vantini, 2017 details). Defaults TRUE. method Permutation method used calculate p-value permutation tests. Choose "residuals" permutations residuals reduced model, according Freedman Lane scheme, "responses" permutation responses, according Manly scheme. stat Type test statistic used global test. Possible values : 'Integral' (default) integral domain F-test statistic; 'Max' max domain F-test statistic.

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
text: object class IWTaov. function summary used obtain print summary results. object list containing following components: call: matched call. design_matrix: design matrix functional--scalar linear model. unadjusted_pval_F: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function functional F-test. adjusted_pval_F: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function functional F-test. unadjusted_pval_factors: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function functional F-tests factor analysis variance (rows). adjusted.pval.factors: Adjusted p-values functional F-tests factor analysis variance (rows) basis coefficient (columns). Global_pval_F: Global p-value overall test F. Global_pval_factors: Global p-value test F involving factor separately. data.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid functional data obtained basis expansion. coeff.regr.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid functional regression coefficients. fitted.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid fitted values functional regression. residuals.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid residuals functional regression. R2.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid functional R-squared regression.

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
text: Abramowicz, K., Pini, ., Schelin, L., Stamm, ., & Vantini, S. (2022). “Domain selection familywise error rate functional data: unified framework. Biometrics 79(2), 1119-1132. D. Freedman D. Lane (1983). Nonstochastic Interpretation Reported Significance Levels. Journal Business & Economic Statistics 1.4, 292-298. B. F. J. Manly (2006). Randomization, Bootstrap Monte Carlo Methods Biology. Vol. 70. CRC Press.

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — Globalaov
code: # Importing the NASA temperatures data set data(NASAtemp) temperature <- rbind(NASAtemp$milan, NASAtemp$paris) groups <- c(rep(0, 22), rep(1, 22))  # Performing the test Global.result <- Globalaov(temperature ~ groups, B = 1000) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'groups' not found  # Summary of the test results summary(Global.result) #> Error: object 'Global.result' not found  # Plot of the results layout(1) plot(Global.result) #> Error: object 'Global.result' not found  # All graphics on the same device layout(matrix(1:4, nrow = 2, byrow = FALSE)) plot(   Global.result,    main = 'NASA data',    plot.adjpval = TRUE,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365) ) #> Error: object 'Global.result' not found

what: Global testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — Globallm
title: Global testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — Globallm
text: function used fit test functional linear models. can used carry regression, analysis variance. implements global testing procedure testing significance effects scalar covariates functional population.

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — Globallm
code: Globallm(   formula,   B = 1000L,   dx = NULL,   recycle = TRUE,   method = "residuals",   stat = "Integral" )

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — Globallm
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. Example: y ~ + B : y matrix dimension n * p containing point-wise evaluations n functional data p points object class fd (see fda package) containing functional data set , B n-dimensional vectors containing values two covariates. Covariates may either scalar factors. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. Defaults 1000L. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step gridused evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100L used. Defaults NULL. recycle Flag used decide whether recycled version IWT used (see Pini Vantini, 2017 details). Defaults TRUE. method Permutation method used calculate p-value permutation tests. Choose "residuals" permutations residuals reduced model, according Freedman Lane scheme, "responses" permutation responses, according Manly scheme. stat Type test statistic used global test. Possible values : 'Integral' (default) integral domain F- t-test statistics; 'Max' max domain F- t-test statistics.

title: Global testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — Globallm
text: object class IWTlm. function summary used obtain print summary results. object list containing following components: call: Call function. design_matrix: Design matrix linear model. unadjusted_pval_F: Unadjusted p-value function F test. adjusted_pval_F: Adjusted p-value function F test. unadjusted_pval_part: Unadjusted p-value functions functional t-tests covariate, separately (rows) domain point (columns). adjusted_pval_part: Adjusted p-values functional t-tests covariate (rows) domain point (columns). Global_pval_F: Global p-value overall test F. Global_pval_part: Global p-value t-test involving covariate separately. data.eval: Evaluation functional data. coeff.regr.eval: Evaluation regression coefficients. fitted.eval: Evaluation fitted values. residuals.eval: Evaluation residuals. R2.eval: Evaluation functional R-suared.

what: Interval Testing Procedure for testing unctional analysis of variance with B-spline basis — ITPaovbspline
title: Interval Testing Procedure for testing unctional analysis of variance with B-spline basis — ITPaovbspline
text: function implements Interval Testing Procedure testing significant differences several functional population evaluated uniform grid, functional analysis variance setting. Data represented means B-spline basis significance basis coefficient tested interval-wise control Family Wise Error Rate. default parameters basis expansion lead piece-wise interpolating function.

title: Interval Testing Procedure for testing unctional analysis of variance with B-spline basis — ITPaovbspline
code: ITPaovbspline(   formula,   order = 2,   nknots = dim(stats::model.response(stats::model.frame(formula)))[2],   B = 1000,   method = "residuals" )

title: Interval Testing Procedure for testing unctional analysis of variance with B-spline basis — ITPaovbspline
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. order Order B-spline basis expansion. default order=2. nknots Number knots B-spline basis expansion. default nknots=dim(data1)[2]. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. defualt B=1000. method Permutation method used calculate p-value permutation tests. Choose "residuals" permutations residuals reduced model, according Freedman Lane scheme, "responses" permutation responses, according Manly scheme.

title: Interval Testing Procedure for testing unctional analysis of variance with B-spline basis — ITPaovbspline
text: ITPaovbspline returns object class "ITPaov". function summary used obtain print summary results. object class "ITPaov" list containing least following components: call matched call. design.matrix design matrix functional--scalar linear model. basis String vector indicating basis used first phase algorithm. case equal "B-spline". coeff Matrix dimensions c(n,p) p coefficients B-spline basis expansion. Rows associated units columns basis index. coeff.regr Matrix dimensions c(L+1,p) p coefficients B-spline basis expansion intercept (first row) L effects covariates specified formula. Columns associated basis index. pval.F Unadjusted p-values functional F-test basis coefficient. pval.matrix.F Matrix dimensions c(p,p) p-values multivariate F-tests. element (,j) matrix pval.matrix contains p-value joint NPC test components (j,j+1,...,j+(p-)). adjusted.pval.F Adjusted p-values functional F-test basis coefficient. pval.factors Unadjusted p-values functional F-tests factor analysis variance, separately (rows) basis coefficient (columns). pval.matrix.factors Array dimensions c(L+1,p,p) p-values multivariate F-tests factors. element (l,,j) array pval.matrix contains p-value joint NPC test factor l components (j,j+1,...,j+(p-)). adjusted.pval.factors adjusted p-values functional F-tests factor analysis variance (rows) basis coefficient (columns). data.eval Evaluation fine uniform grid functional data obtained basis expansion. coeff.regr.eval Evaluation fine uniform grid functional regression coefficients. fitted.eval Evaluation fine uniform grid fitted values functional regression. residuals.eval Evaluation fine uniform grid residuals functional regression. R2.eval Evaluation fine uniform grid functional R-squared regression. heatmap.matrix.F Heatmap matrix p-values functional F-test (used plots). heatmap.matrix.factors Heatmap matrix p-values functional F-tests factor analysis variance (used plots).

what: One population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP1bspline
title: One population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP1bspline
text: function implements Interval Wise Testing procedure testing center symmetry functional population. Functional data tested locally  unadjusted  adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls interval-wise error rate.

title: One population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP1bspline
code: ITP1bspline(data, mu = 0, B = 1000, order = 2, nknots = dim(data)[2])  ITP1fourier(data, mu = 0, B = 1000, maxfrequency = floor(dim(data)[2]/2))  IWT1(data, mu = 0, B = 1000, dx = NULL, recycle = TRUE)

title: One population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP1bspline
text: data Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd. pointwise evaluations provided, data matrix dimensions c(n, J), J evaluations columns n units rows. mu center symmetry null hypothesis. Three possibilities available mu: constant (case, constant function used); J-dimensional vector containing evaluations grid data evaluated; fd object containing one function. Defaults 0. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. Defaults 1000L. order Order B-spline basis expansion. Defaults 2L. nknots Number knots B-spline basis expansion. Defaults dim(data)[2]. maxfrequency maximum frequency used Fourier basis expansion data. Defaults floor(dim(data)[2] / 2), leading interpolating expansion. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step gridused evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100L used. Defaults NULL. recycle Flag used decide whether recycled version IWT used (see Pini Vantini, 2017 details). Defaults TRUE.

title: One population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP1bspline
text: object class IWT1, list containing least following components: test: String vector indicating type test performed. case equal "1pop". mu: Evaluation grid center symmetry null hypothesis (entered user). unadjusted_pval: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function. pval_matrix: Matrix dimensions c(p, p) p-values multivariate tests. element (,j) matrix pval.matrix contains p-value joint NPC test components (j,j+1,...,j+(p-)). adjusted_pval: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function. data.eval: Evaluation grid functional data.

what: Two population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP2bspline
title: Two population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP2bspline
text: function implements Interval Wise Testing procedure testing mean differences two functional populations. Functional data tested locally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls interval-wise error rate.

title: Two population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP2bspline
code: ITP2bspline(   data1,   data2,   mu = 0,   B = 1000,   paired = FALSE,   order = 2,   nknots = dim(data1)[2] )  ITP2fourier(   data1,   data2,   mu = 0,   B = 1000,   paired = FALSE,   maxfrequency = floor(dim(data1)[2]/2) )  ITP2pafourier(   data1,   data2,   mu = 0,   B = 1000,   paired = FALSE,   maxfrequency = floor(dim(data1)[2]/2) )  IWT2(   data1,   data2,   mu = 0,   B = 1000L,   dx = NULL,   recycle = TRUE,   paired = FALSE,   alternative = "two.sided",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Two population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP2bspline
text: data1 First population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object. pointwise evaluations provided, matrix dimensions c(n1, J), J evaluations columns n1 units rows. data2 Second population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object. pointwise evaluations provided, matrix dimensions c(n2, J), J evaluations columns n2 units rows. mu Functional mean difference null hypothesis. Three possibilities available mu: constant (case, constant function used); J-dimensional vector containing evaluations grid data evaluated; fd object package fda containing one function. Defaults mu = 0. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. Defaults 1000L. paired Flag indicating whether paired test performed. Defaults FALSE. order Order B-spline basis expansion. Defaults 2L. nknots Number knots B-spline basis expansion. Defaults dim(data1)[2]. maxfrequency maximum frequency used Fourier basis expansion data. Defaults floor(dim(data1)[2] / 2), leading interpolating expansion. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step gridused evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100L used. Defaults NULL. recycle Flag used decide whether recycled version IWT used (see Pini Vantini, 2017 details). Defaults TRUE. alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis. Must one "two.sided" (default), "greater" "less". verbose Logical: FALSE, reduces amount output. Default TRUE.

title: Two population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP2bspline
text: object class IWT2, list containing least following components: test: String vector indicating type test performed. case equal "2pop". mu: Evaluation grid functional mean difference null hypothesis (entered user). unadjusted_pval: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function. pval_matrix: Matrix dimensions c(p, p) p-values interval-wise tests. element (, j) matrix pval.matrix contains p-value test contains p-value test interval indexed (j,j+1,...,j+(p-)). adjusted_pval: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function. data.eval: Evaluation grid functional data. ord_labels: Vector labels indicating group membership data.eval.

title: Two population Interval Wise Testing procedure — ITP2bspline
text: . Pini S. Vantini (2017). Interval Testing Procedure: Inference Functional Data Controlling Family Wise Error Rate Intervals. Biometrics, 73(3): 835–845. . Pini S. Vantini (2017). Interval-wise testing functional data. Journal Nonparametric Statistics, 29(2), 407-424.

what: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
title: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
text: function implements Interval Wise Testing procedure testing mean differences several functional populations one-way multi-way functional analysis variance framework. Functional data tested locally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls interval-wise error rate.

title: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
code: IWTaov(formula, B = 1000L, method = "residuals", dx = NULL, recycle = TRUE)

title: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. output variable formula can either matrix dimension c(n,J) collecting pointwise evaluations n functional data grid J points, fd object package fda. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. defualt B=1000. method Permutation method used calculate p-value permutation tests. Choose "residuals" permutations residuals reduced model, according Freedman Lane scheme, "responses" permutation responses, according Manly scheme. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step grid  used evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100 used. Default NULL. recycle Flag used decide whether recycled version IWT used (see Pini Vantini, 2017 details). Default TRUE.

title: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
text: IWTaov returns object class "IWTaov". function summary used obtain print summary results. object class "IWTaov" list containing least following components: call: matched call. design_matrix: design matrix functional--scalar linear model. unadjusted_pval_F: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function functional F-test. pval_matrix_F: Matrix dimensions c(p,p) p-values intervalwise F-tests. element \((,j)\) matrix pval.matrix contains p-value test interval indexed \((j,j+1,...,j+(p-))\). adjusted_pval_F: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function functional F-test. unadjusted_pval_factors: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function functional F-tests factor analysis variance (rows). pval_matrix_factors: Array dimensions c(L+1,p,p) p-values multivariate F-tests factors. element \((l,,j)\) array pval.matrix contains p-value joint NPC test factor l components \((j,j+1,...,j+(p-))\). adjusted_pval_factors: Adjusted p-values functional F-tests factor analysis variance (rows) basis coefficient (columns). data.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid functional data obtained basis expansion. coeff.regr.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid functional regression coefficients. fitted.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid fitted values functional regression. residuals.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid residuals functional regression. R2.eval: Evaluation fine uniform grid functional R-squared regression. heatmap.matrix.F: Heatmap matrix p-values functional F-test (used plots). heatmap.matrix.factors: Heatmap matrix p-values functional F-tests factor analysis variance (used plots).

title: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
text: Pini, ., & Vantini, S. (2017). Interval-wise testing functional data. Journal Nonparametric Statistics, 29(2), 407-424. Pini, ., Vantini, S., Colosimo, B. M., & Grasso, M. (2018). Domain‐selective functional analysis variance supervised statistical profile monitoring signal data. Journal Royal Statistical Society: Series C (Applied Statistics) 67(1), 55-81. Abramowicz, K., Hager, C. K., Pini, ., Schelin, L., Sjostedt de Luna, S., & Vantini, S. (2018). Nonparametric inference functional‐‐scalar linear models applied knee kinematic hop data injury anterior cruciate ligament. Scandinavian Journal Statistics 45(4), 1036-1061. D. Freedman D. Lane (1983). Nonstochastic Interpretation Reported Significance Levels. Journal Business & Economic Statistics 1.4, 292-298. B. F. J. Manly (2006). Randomization, Bootstrap Monte Carlo Methods Biology. Vol. 70. CRC Press.

title: Interval Wise Testing procedure for testing functional analysis of variance — IWTaov
code: temperature <- rbind(NASAtemp$milan, NASAtemp$paris) groups <- c(rep(0, 22), rep(1, 22))  # Performing the IWT IWT.result <- IWTaov(temperature ~ groups, B = 10L) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'groups' not found  # Summary of the ITP results summary(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # Plot of the IWT results graphics::layout(1) plot(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # All graphics on the same device graphics::layout(matrix(1:4, nrow = 2, byrow = FALSE)) plot(   IWT.result,    main = 'NASA data',    plot.adjpval = TRUE,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365) ) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found

title: Heatmap plot of the Interval Wise Testing Procedure results — IWTimage

what: Interval-wise testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — IWTlm
title: Interval-wise testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — IWTlm
text: function used fit test functional linear models. can used carry regression, analysis variance. implements interval-wise testing procedure (IWT) testing significance effects scalar covariates functional population.

title: Interval-wise testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — IWTlm
code: IWTlm(formula, B = 1000L, method = "residuals", dx = NULL, recycle = TRUE)

title: Interval-wise testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — IWTlm
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. Example: y ~ + B : y matrix dimension n * p containing point-wise evaluations n functional data p points object class fd (see fda package) containing functional data set , B n-dimensional vectors containing values two covariates. Covariates may either scalar factors. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. defualt B=1000. method Permutation method used calculate p-value permutation tests. Choose "residuals" permutations residuals reduced model, according Freedman Lane scheme, "responses" permutation responses, according Manly scheme. dx step size point-wise evaluations functional data. dx used ia object class 'fd' provided response formula. recycle flag specifying whether recycled version IWT used.

title: Interval-wise testing procedure for testing functional-on-scalar linear models — IWTlm
text: IWTlm returns object class "IWTlm". function summary used obtain print summary results. object class "ITPlm" list containing least following components: call: Call function. design_matrix: Design matrix linear model. unadjusted_pval_F: Unadjusted p-value function F test. pval_matrix_F: Matrix dimensions c(p,p) p-values interval-wise F-tests. element \((,j)\) matrix pval_matrix_F contains p-value test interval \((j,j+1,...,j+(p-))\). adjusted_pval_F: Adjusted p-value function F test. unadjusted_pval_part: Unadjusted p-value functions functional t-tests covariate, separately (rows) domain point (columns). pval_matrix_part: Array dimensions c(L+1,p,p) p-values interval-wise t-tests covariates. element \((l,,j)\) array pval_matrix_part contains p-value test covariate l interval \((j,j+1,...,j+(p-))\). adjusted_pval_part: Adjusted p-values functional t-tests covariate (rows) domain point (columns). data.eval: Evaluation functional data. coeff.regr.eval: Evaluation regression coefficients. fitted.eval: Evaluation fitted values. residuals.eval: Evaluation residuals. R2.eval: Evaluation functional R-suared.

code: # Defining the covariates temperature <- rbind(NASAtemp$milan, NASAtemp$paris) groups <- c(rep(0, 22), rep(1, 22))  # Performing the IWT IWT.result <- IWTlm(temperature ~ groups, B = 3L) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'groups' not found # Summary of the IWT results summary(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # Plot of the IWT results graphics::layout(1) plot(   IWT.result,    main = 'NASA data',    plot_adjpval = TRUE,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365) ) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # All graphics on the same device graphics::layout(matrix(1:6, nrow = 3, byrow = FALSE)) plot(   IWT.result,    main = 'NASA data',    plot_adjpval = TRUE,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365) ) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found

what: NASA daily temperatures data set — NASAtemp
title: NASA daily temperatures data set — NASAtemp
text: contains daily mean temperatures registered July 1983 June 2005 stored NASA database Earth Surface Meteorology Solar Energy two different geographical locations: region (45-46 North, 9-10 East), including city Milan (Italy), region (48-49 North, 2-3 East), including city Paris (France).

title: NASA daily temperatures data set — NASAtemp
code: NASAtemp

title: NASA daily temperatures data set — NASAtemp
text: List 2 elements: milan: Matrix dimensions c(22, 365) containing daily mean temperatures region (45-46 North, 9-10 East), including city Milan (Italy) registered July 1983 June 2005 (22 years). paris: Matrix dimensions c(22, 365) containing daily mean temperatures region (48-49 North, 2-3 East), including city Paris (France) registered July 1983 June 2005 (22 years).

title: NASA daily temperatures data set — NASAtemp
text: data obtained NASA Langley Research Center Atmospheric Science Data Center Surface meteorological Solar Energy (SSE) web portal supported NASA LaRC POWER Project. Data freely available : NASA Surface Meteorology Solar Energy, Renewable Energy Resource web site (release 6.0).

what: Two population Partition Closed Testing procedure — PCT2
title: Two population Partition Closed Testing procedure — PCT2
text: function implements Partition Closed Testing procedure testing mean differences two functional populations. Functional data tested locally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function controls family-wise error rate asymptotically.

title: Two population Partition Closed Testing procedure — PCT2
code: PCT2(   data1,   data2,   partition,   mu = 0,   B = 1000L,   paired = FALSE,   dx = NULL,   alternative = "two.sided" )

title: Two population Partition Closed Testing procedure — PCT2
text: data1 First population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n1 units rows. data2 Second population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n2 units rows. partition Vector length J containing labels assigning point domain element partition. mu Functional mean difference null hypothesis. Three possibilities available mu: constant (case, constant function used); J-dimensional vector containing evaluations grid data evaluated; fd object package fda containing one function. default mu=0. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. defualt B=1000. paired Flag indicating whether paired test performed. Default FALSE. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step grid  used evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100 used. Default NULL. alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis, must one "two.sided" (default), "greater" "less".

title: Two population Partition Closed Testing procedure — PCT2
text: object class fdatest2 containing following components: test: String vector indicating type test performed. case equal "2pop". mu: Evaluation grid functional mean difference null hypothesis (entered user). unadjusted_pval: Evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function. adjusted_pval: Evaluation grid adjusted p-value function. data.eval: Evaluation grid functional data. ord_labels: Vector labels indicating group membership data.eval.

what: fdatest: Interval Wise Testing for Functional Data — fdatest-package
title: fdatest: Interval Wise Testing for Functional Data — fdatest-package
text: Implementation local inferential procedures functional data different frameworks (.e., one two-population frameworks, functional linear models). current version package requires functional data evaluated uniform grid fda objects, provides adjusted unadjusted p-value functions based nonparametric local tests. package provides plotting function creating graphical output procedure: p-value heat-map, plot p-value functions, plot functional data.

what: Two population local testing procedures — fdatest2
title: Two population local testing procedures — fdatest2
text: function implements local testing procedures testing mean differences two functional populations. Functional data tested locally unadjusted adjusted p-value functions provided. unadjusted p-value function controls point-wise error rate. adjusted p-value function can computed according following methods:

title: Two population local testing procedures — fdatest2
code: fdatest2(   data1,   data2,   method,   mu = 0,   B = 1000L,   paired = FALSE,   dx = NULL,   alternative = "two.sided",   recycle = TRUE,   partition = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Two population local testing procedures — fdatest2
text: data1 First population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n1 units rows. data2 Second population's data. Either pointwise evaluations functional data set uniform grid, fd object package fda. pointwise evaluations provided, data2 matrix dimensions c(n1,J), J evaluations columns n2 units rows. method character string specifying method chosen adjust p-value. one following: "Global", "IWT", "TWT", "PCT", "FDR". mu Functional mean difference null hypothesis. Three possibilities available mu: constant (case, constant function used); J-dimensional vector containing evaluations grid data evaluated; fd object package fda containing one function. Defaults mu = 0. B number iterations MC algorithm evaluate p-values permutation tests. Defaults 1000L. paired Flag indicating whether paired test performed. Defaults FALSE. dx Used fd object provided. case, dx size discretization step gridused evaluate functional data. set NULL, grid size 100L used. Defaults NULL. alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis. Must one "two.sided" (default), "greater" "less". recycle Flag used decide whether recycled version IWT used (see Pini Vantini, 2017 details). Defaults TRUE. partition Used method="PCT". partition used PCT procedure. Default NULL. verbose Logical: FALSE, reduces amount output. Default TRUE.

title: Two population local testing procedures — fdatest2
text: object class fdatest2 containing least following components: test: string vector indicating type test performed. case equal "2pop". mu: evaluation grid functional mean difference null hypothesis (entered user). unadjusted_pval: evaluation grid unadjusted p-value function. adjusted_pval: evaluation grid adjusted p-value function. data.eval: evaluation grid functional data. ord_labels: vector labels indicating group membership data.eval.

text: plot method class "ITP2". Plotting function creating graphical output ITP test comparison two populations: functional data ITP-adjusted p-values plotted.

title: Plot method for ITP results on two-population tests — plot.ITP2
code: # S3 method for class 'ITP2' plot(   x,   xrange = c(0, 1),   alpha1 = 0.05,   alpha2 = 0.01,   ylab = "Functional Data",   main = NULL,   lwd = 1,   col = c(1, 2),   pch = 16,   ylim = range(object$data.eval),   ... )

title: Plot method for ITP results on two-population tests — plot.ITP2
text: x object plotted. object class "ITP2", , result ITP comparison two populations. Usually call ITP2bspline, ITP2fourier ITP2pafourier. xrange Range x axis. Default xrange=c(0,1). alpha1 First level significance used select display significant differences. Default alpha1 = 0.05. alpha2 Second level significance used select display significant differences. Default alpha1 = 0.01. alpha1 alpha2 s.t. alpha2 < alpha1. Otherwise two values switched. ylab Label y axis plot functional data. Default "Functional Data". main overall title plots (pasted "Functional Data" first plot "adjusted p-values" second plot). lwd Line width plot functional data. col Color used plot functional data. pch Point character plot adjusted p-values. ylim Range y axis. ... Additional plotting arguments can used function plot, graphical parameters (see par).

title: Plot method for ITP results on two-population tests — plot.ITP2
text: value returned. function produces graphical output ITP results:  plot functional data one adjusted p-values. basis components selected significant test level alpha1 alpha2 highlighted plot adjusted p-values one functional data (case test based local basis, B-splines) gray areas (light dark gray, respectively). case Fourier basis amplitude phase decomposition, two plots adjusted p-values done, one phase one amplitude.

title: Plot method for ITP results on two-population tests — plot.ITP2
code: # Performing the ITP for two populations with the B-spline basis ITP.result.bspline <- ITP2bspline(   NASAtemp$milan, NASAtemp$paris,    nknots = 30, B = 10L )  # Plotting the results of the ITP plot(   ITP.result.bspline,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365),    main = 'NASA data' )    # Selecting the significant components for the radius at 5% level which(ITP.result.bspline$adjusted.pval < 0.05) #> integer(0)

title: Plot method for ITP results on functional ANOVA — plot.ITPaov
text: x object plotted. object class "ITPaov", usually, result call ITPaovbspline. xrange Range x axis. alpha1 First level significance used select display significant effects. Default alpha1 = 0.05. alpha2 Second level significance used select display significant effects. Default alpha1 = 0.01. alpha1 alpha2 s.t. alpha2 < alpha1. Otherwise two values switched. plot.adjpval logical indicating wether plots adjusted p-values done. Default plot_adjpval = FALSE. ylim Range y axis. Default NULL, giving plot authomatic range functional data. col Colors plot functional data. Default col = 1. ylab Label y axis plot functional data. Default "Functional Data". main overall title plots (pasted "Functional Data F-test" first plot factor names plots). lwd Line width plot functional data. Default lwd=1. pch Point character plot adjusted p-values. Default pch=16. ... Additional plotting arguments can used function plot, graphical parameters (see par).

title: Plot method for ITP results on functional ANOVA — plot.ITPaov
text: value returned. function produces graphical output ITP results:  plot functional data one adjusted p-values. portions domain selected significant test level alpha1 alpha2 highlighted plot adjusted p-value function one functional data gray areas (light dark gray, respectively). first plot reports gray areas corresponding significant F-test whole model. remaining plots report gray areas corresponding significant F-tests factor (colors corresponding levels factor).

title: Plot method for ITP results on functional ANOVA — plot.ITPaov
code: temperature <- rbind(NASAtemp$milan,NASAtemp$paris) groups <- c(rep(0,22),rep(1,22))  # Performing the ITP ITP.result <- ITPaovbspline(temperature ~ groups,B=100,nknots=20,order=3) #> [1] "First step: basis expansion" #> Swapping 'y' and 'argvals', because 'y' is  simpler, #>   and 'argvals' should be;  now  dim(argvals) =  365 ;  dim(y) =  365 x 44  #> [1] "Second step: joint univariate tests" #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'groups' not found  # Summary of the ITP results summary(ITP.result) #> Error: object 'ITP.result' not found  # Plot of the ITP results graphics::layout(1) plot(ITP.result) #> Error: object 'ITP.result' not found  # All graphics on the same device graphics::layout(matrix(1:4,nrow=2,byrow=FALSE)) plot(ITP.result,main='NASA data', plot_adjpval = TRUE,xlab='Day',xrange=c(1,365)) #> Error: object 'ITP.result' not found

what: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
title: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
text: plot method class "IWTaov". Plotting function creating graphical output IWT test functional analysis variance: functional data, IWT-adjusted p-values F-tests whole model factor plotted.

title: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
code: # S3 method for class 'IWTaov' plot(   x,   xrange = c(0, 1),   alpha1 = 0.05,   alpha2 = 0.01,   plot_adjpval = FALSE,   ylim = NULL,   col = 1,   ylab = "Functional Data",   main = NULL,   lwd = 0.5,   type = "l",   ... )

title: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
text: x object plotted. object class "IWTaov", usually, result call IWTaov. xrange Range x axis. alpha1 First level significance used select display significant effects. Default alpha1 = 0.05. alpha2 Second level significance used select display significant effects. Default alpha1 = 0.01. alpha1 alpha2 s.t. alpha2 < alpha1. Otherwise two values switched. plot_adjpval logical indicating wether plots adjusted p-values done. Default plot_adjpval = FALSE. ylim Range y axis. Default NULL, giving plot authomatic range functional data. col Colors plot functional data. Default col = 1. ylab Label y axis plot functional data. Default "Functional Data". main overall title plots (pasted "Functional Data F-test" first plot factor names plots). lwd Line width plot adjusted p-value function. Default lwd=1. type line type plot adjusted p-value function. Default type='l'. ... Additional plotting arguments can used function plot, graphical parameters (see par).

title: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
text: value returned. function produces graphical output IWT results:  plot functional data one adjusted p-values. portions domain selected significant test level alpha1 alpha2 highlighted plot adjusted p-value function one functional data gray areas (light dark gray, respectively). first plot reports gray areas corresponding significant F-test whole model. remaining plots report gray areas corresponding significant F-tests factor (colors corresponding levels factor).

title: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
text: Pini, ., & Vantini, S. (2017). Interval-wise testing functional data. Journal Nonparametric Statistics, 29(2), 407-424. Pini, ., Vantini, S., Colosimo, B. M., & Grasso, M. (2018). Domain‐selective functional analysis variance supervised statistical profile monitoring signal data. Journal Royal Statistical Society: Series C (Applied Statistics) 67(1), 55-81. Abramowicz, K., Hager, C. K., Pini, ., Schelin, L., Sjostedt de Luna, S., & Vantini, S. (2018). Nonparametric inference functional‐‐scalar linear models applied knee kinematic hop data injury anterior cruciate ligament. Scandinavian Journal Statistics 45(4), 1036-1061.

title: Plot method for IWT results on functional ANOVA — plot.IWTaov
code: temperature <- rbind(NASAtemp$milan, NASAtemp$paris) groups <- c(rep(0, 22), rep(1, 22))  # Performing the IWT IWT.result <- IWTaov(temperature ~ groups, B = 10L) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'groups' not found  # Summary of the IWT results summary(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # Plot of the IWT results graphics::layout(1) plot(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # All graphics on the same device graphics::layout(matrix(1:4, nrow = 2, byrow = FALSE)) plot(   IWT.result,    main = 'NASA data',    plot_adjpval = TRUE,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365) ) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found

code: # Importing the NASA temperatures data set data(NASAtemp)  temperature <- rbind(NASAtemp$milan, NASAtemp$paris) groups <- c(rep(0, 22), rep(1, 22))  # Performing the IWT IWT.result <- IWTaov(temperature ~ groups, B = 10L) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'groups' not found  # Summary of the IWT results summary(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # Plot of the IWT results layout(1) plot(IWT.result) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found  # All graphics on the same device layout(matrix(1:4, nrow = 2, byrow = FALSE)) plot(   IWT.result,    main = 'NASA data',    plot_adjpval = TRUE,    xlab = 'Day',    xrange = c(1, 365) ) #> Error: object 'IWT.result' not found
